channel.description:
[url='https://www.teamfortress.com/post.php?id=3727']https://www.teamfortress.com/post.php?id=3727[/url]
Anyone else think this is dumb? It's Valve's fault in the first place for making weapons be random drops, and then making the stupid crafting system require 81 weapons to craft a random hat and 112 for a class-specific hat. Now they're basically making it impossible to craft hats at a reasonable rate, unless drops are gonna be in terms of minutes instead of hours. Dammit Valve, you can't promise us hats and make them so hard to get!!! :FFFUUU:

item.title: TF2 Drops Update
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
Sorry to necropost, but I just wanted to let you know about the drops update after playing through it a while.

First of all, within the time allotted for finding drops, you get a lot more than previously. So that has been working well, especially for those who don’t play much. I’ve often found two or three drops in one session of playing (1-2 hours). So for those who don’t play often it is much, much better.

Second, I can’t find an update news post where it says it, but they’ve reduced the crafting requirements for making scrap metal. It’s now 2 weapons (either 2 of the same weapon, or 2 weapons used by the same class) to craft a piece of scrap metal, instead of 3. This means the cost and time of crafting has dropped greatly, since you find more drops and it takes fewer items to craft a weapon or hat (and I believe the tokens have also dropped one item from the requirement, taking 3 items instead of 4).

With this going well and the engie update coming soon, there’s plenty of reason to play again. I look forward to killing you soon!

item.title: TF2 Drops Update
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
Mr.Shadow:

Sandman’s good? I don’t find the stun be worth the health loss. Not anymore.

I prefer the Sandman. Scout’s advantage is not health but speed and surprise. Also very team friendly, e.g. if someone’s about to get torn up by a heavy, stun him so your teammate has time to run or take him out.

Also for Pyro…flamethrower is really the best choice if you know how to use it well. The times you wish had been using the flamethrower are many more than the times you wish you were using a backburner. Airblast can reflect projectiles, extinguish teammates (damn how i wish more people knew this!), and can even completely counteract ubercharges. In most cases however neither option is really a bad one, it’s just how you use it.

item.title: TF2 Drops Update
item.dc:creator: Mr.Shadow
item.description:
Grey Acumen:

This is relevant to my interests (I’ll find the lolcat image for it later)

Seriously, this is actually incentive for me to start playing TF2 again, even despite the fact that I generally get my ass kicked in it. Maybe I’ll be able to stick to it long enough to actually learn some of the strategy to the different classes.

As scout: Suprise, stay calm and yet be agressive.

As sniper: Stay out of scope most of the time and only scope in when somethings there. Only charge up when you need to. And be twitchy with your arm.

As Heavy: Generally communicate and work as a team. And have a medic. That’s all to it.

As Pyro: Keep practicing.

These are the general tactics on classes I like and find very efficient (first two for comp play and pugs, last two for pubs.)

On topic: Good change. I don’t like the item limit time thingy though.
